content:
Diagnosis
	1. Extensive stage large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma of lung with liver and bone metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative - Disease control

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated

	Radiotherapy
	15 Feb 2024 Palliative radiotherapy to T7 vertebral metastasis

	Chemotherapy
	Carboplatin/Etoposide completed 4 cycles March 2024 with partial response

	Clinical studies
	IMPACT-NE trial registration completed today

	Current disease status
	Partial response to first line therapy. Now eligible for trial participation.

	Current issues
	Mild peripheral neuropathy from previous chemotherapy

	Summary of consultation
	This 58-year-old gentleman has shown good partial response to initial carboplatin/etoposide with reduction in liver metastases and improvement in bone pain. Performance status has improved from 2 to 1. Molecular testing confirms RB1 and TP53 loss. All eligibility criteria for IMPACT-NE trial have been met including adequate organ function and resolution of previous grade 2 thrombocytopenia.

Trial procedures completed today include baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis, ECG, echocardiogram, and required blood tests. Patient has signed informed consent after detailed discussion of trial requirements, risks, and benefits. Randomization completed - allocated to experimental arm (AMG 123 + SOC).

	Further investigations
	Baseline brain MRI scheduled 25 April 2024

	Medication prescribed
	Trial medication to commence 29 April 2024 pending brain MRI

	Follow up
	Trial assessment clinic in 2 weeks
	Cycle 1 Day 1 scheduled for 29 April 2024

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC, U&E, LFT monitoring as per trial protocol

	Summary of information given to patient
	Provided with trial emergency card, medication diary, and 24-hour contact numbers. Advised regarding required frequency of hospital visits and monitoring requirements.

cancer_timeline.value: Palliative radiotherapy to T7 vertebral metastasis
Completed 4 cycles Carboplatin/Etoposide with partial response
Enrolled in IMPACT-NE trial, randomized to experimental arm (AMG 123 + SOC)

patient_facts.value: Mild peripheral neuropathy from previous chemotherapy
Adequate organ function confirmed on baseline testing

status_updates.value: Extensive stage neuroendocrine lung cancer showing partial response to first-line chemotherapy. Now enrolled in IMPACT-NE trial.
Partial response with reduction in liver metastases and improvement in bone pain
Randomized to experimental arm of IMPACT-NE trial (AMG 123 + SOC)
Trial assessment clinic in 2 weeks, Cycle 1 Day 1 scheduled for 29 April 2024
